verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying, “Arise and go to Nineveh, the great city, and preach in it; for the cry of her wickedness has come up to me.” But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.

But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.

verses.text: But the Lord raised up a great wind upon the sea, and there came about a mighty tempest, and the ship was in danger of breaking up.
parts: But the Lord raised up a great wind upon the sea, and there came about a mighty tempest, and the ship was in danger of breaking up.

verses.text: And the mariners were afraid and cried out, each one to his god.

verses.text: The captain came to him and said, “Why are you snoring?

verses.text: And each one said to his shipmate, “Come!

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Tell us, what is your occupation?
parts: Then they said to him, “Tell us, what is your occupation?

verses.text: And he said to them, “I am a servant of the Lord, and I worship the Lord God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”
parts: And he said to them, “I am a servant of the Lord, and I worship the Lord God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”

verses.text: Then the men were exceedingly afraid and said to him, “What is this that you did?” For the men knew he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.
parts: Then the men were exceedingly afraid and said to him, “What is this that you did?” For the men knew he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.

verses.text: Then they said to him, “What should we do to you that the sea will calm itself for us?” For the sea continued to be tempestuous, and the waves rose up even higher.
parts: Then they said to him, “What should we do to you that the sea will calm itself for us?” For the sea continued to be tempestuous, and the waves rose up even higher.

verses.text: And Jonah said to them, “Take me up and cast me into the sea, and the sea will grow calm for you, for I know this great tempest is upon you because of me.”
parts: And Jonah said to them, “Take me up and cast me into the sea, and the sea will grow calm for you, for I know this great tempest is upon you because of me.”

verses.text: And the men tried hard to return to the land, but were unable to do so, for the sea arose and grew even more tempestuous against them.
parts: And the men tried hard to return to the land, but were unable to do so, for the sea arose and grew even more tempestuous against them.

verses.text: Then they cried out to the Lord and said, “Please, O Lord, do not let us perish on account of this man's life, nor bring righteous blood upon us; for you, O Lord, have brought this about.”
parts: Then they cried out to the Lord and said, “Please, O Lord, do not let us perish on account of this man's life, nor bring righteous blood upon us; for you, O Lord, have brought this about.”

verses.text: So they took up Jonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea ceased from its raging.
parts: So they took up Jonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea ceased from its raging.

verses.text: And the men feared the Lord even more, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and vowed vows.
parts: And the men feared the Lord even more, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and vowed vows.

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time, saying, “Arise and go to Nineveh, the great city, and preach there according to the message I previously spoke to you.” So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh, just as the Lord spoke.

verses.text: And Jonah began to enter into the city, going a day's journey, where he proclaimed and said, “Yet three days and Nineveh shall be overthrown.”

verses.text: And the men of Nineveh believed God.

verses.text: Then the word came to the king of Nineveh; and he arose from his throne, removed his robe, and put on sackcloth, and sat upon ashes.

verses.text: And it was proclaimed and spoken in Nineveh by the king and by his great men, saying, “Let not the men, cattle, oxen, or sheep taste anything, eat, or drink water.”

verses.text: So the men and the cattle were clothed with sackcloth, and they cried out fervently to God; and they each turned back from their evil ways and from the wrongdoings of their hands, saying,

verses.text: “Who knows if God shall have a change of heart and turn from His fierce anger, that we should not perish?”
parts: “Who knows if God shall have a change of heart and turn from His fierce anger, that we should not perish?”

verses.text: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil ways.
parts: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil ways.

verses.text: But Jonah was deeply grieved and was troubled. So he prayed to the Lord and said, “O Lord, were these not my words when I was yet in my land?

verses.text: And now, Master, Lord, take my life from me, for it is better for me to die than to live.”

verses.text: And the Lord said to Jonah, “Are you exceedingly grieved?” Then Jonah went out of the city and seated himself opposite it.

verses.text: And the Lord God commanded a gourd, and it came up over the head of Jonah to be a shade over his head, to shield him from his discomforts.

verses.text: But early the next morning, God commanded a worm, and it smote the gourd, and the gourd withered up.

verses.text: And when the sun rose, God commanded a burning east wind; and the sun beat down on the head of Jonah, and he grew faint and despaired of his life.

verses.text: Then God said to Jonah, “Are you exceedingly grieved on account of the gourd?” And he said, “I am exceedingly grieved, even unto death.”
parts: Then God said to Jonah, “Are you exceedingly grieved on account of the gourd?” And he said, “I am exceedingly grieved, even unto death.”

verses.text: And the Lord said, “You took pity on the gourd, for which you did not labor, nor did you make it grow, which came up during the night and perished before the next night.
parts: And the Lord said, “You took pity on the gourd, for which you did not labor, nor did you make it grow, which came up during the night and perished before the next night.

verses.text: And shall I Myself not take pity upon Nineveh, the great city, in which dwell more than one hundred and twenty thousand people who do not know either their right hand or their left—and many livestock?”
